SEARCH
Package gw.document

Class DocumentContentsInfo

java.lang.Object
gw.document.DocumentContentsInfo
Direct Known Subclasses:
DocumentContentsInfo
public class DocumentContentsInfo extends Object
Class encapsulating the response from either a document creation or document retrieval request. The idea here is that document contents may be made accessible to the UI through two possible mechanisms:
  • Raw document contents
  • A URL which, when accessed by the user, will cause the document to be displayed
This class contains information letting the UI code know which of the types of response it is, and providing the relevant information for the given response type.
Author:
bjohnson, bdantes

  • Constructor Details

    • DocumentContentsInfo

      public DocumentContentsInfo(DocumentContentsInfo.ContentResponseType responseType, InputStream inputStream, String mimeType)
      Basic Constructor
      Parameters:
      responseType - The type of response (document contents, html, or url)
      inputStream - A stream containing the value of the response
      mimeType - MIME type of the content

    • DocumentContentsInfo

      public DocumentContentsInfo(DocumentContentsInfo.ContentResponseType responseType, String content, String mimeType)
      Convenience constructor for situations where the caller has the response content in a string
      Parameters:
      responseType - The type of response (document contents, url or url direct)
      content - A String containing the value of the response
      mimeType - MIME type of the content

  • Method Details

    • getDocumentContents

      public static DocumentContentsInfo getDocumentContents(String strDocUID, DocumentContentsInfo.ContentResponseType contentResponseType, String contentURL, String documentURL, String documentsDir, String demoDocumentsDir, ContentDispositionType contentDispositionType, boolean includeContents)
      Builds the DocumentContentsInfo containing the document contents information. Most of the code in this method exists for the testing-time "mode" parameter; see the CONTENT_MODE section for the standard content-returning scenario. This method is provided for testing purpose. They allow simulation of different kinds of content response
      Parameters:
      strDocUID - The DocUID of the document whose contents should be returned
      contentResponseType - the #ContentResponseType of the document
      contentURL - URL of the content if it is URL or URL_DIRECT mode
      documentURL - URL of the document if it is CONTENT_MODE
      documentsDir - documents directory for retrieving the content
      demoDocumentsDir - Backup directory for retrieving the content, this is used for demo purpose
      contentDispositionType - ContentDispositionType for document if not otherwise specified
      includeContents - If true, the actual contents of the document should be included in the DocumentContentsInfo
      Returns:
      A DocumentContentsInfo object with the metadata of the Document Contents, and possibly the contents themselves

    • getInputStream

      public InputStream getInputStream()
      Returns:
      A Stream containing the value of the response

    • setResponseMimeType

      public void setResponseMimeType(String responseMimeType)
      Parameters:
      responseMimeType - The mime type of the value of the response. This should be either the mime type of the document itself if the response is returning document contents, or the appropriate mime type of the web content. For URL responses this value is not meaningful.

    • getResponseMimeType

      public String getResponseMimeType()
      Returns:
      The mime type of the value of the response. This will be either the mime type of the document itself if the response is returning document contents, or the appropriate mime type of the web content. For URL responses this value is not meaningful.

    • setContentDispositionType

      public void setContentDispositionType(ContentDispositionType contentDispositionType)
      Parameters:
      contentDispositionType - This should be set to ContentDispositionType.ATTACHMENT for web page or url contents if the UI should render them using a hidden frame in the browser, for example if the web page being returned contains javascript to pop up another page with the real document contents. For document contents responses, this will not be meaningful.

    • getContentDispositionType

      public ContentDispositionType getContentDispositionType()
      Returns:
      True for web page or url contents if the UI should render them using a hidden frame in the browser, for example if the web page being returned contains javascript to pop up another page with the real document contents. False otherwise. For document contents responses, this will not be meaningful.

    • getResponseType

      public DocumentContentsInfo.ContentResponseType getResponseType()
      Returns:
      A constant indicating the type of response.
